statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Portland St. 70, Montana 68
article.story: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) -- Jeremiah Dominguez scored 26 points, including the winning free throws with 5.7 seconds left, to lead Portland State to a 70-68 win over Montana on Thursday. Deonte Huff added 18 points for the Vikings (12-8, 5-2 Big Sky Conference) and Scott Morrison chipped in 13 points. Mike Martin and Ceylon Elgin-Taylor led Montana (9-12, 3-5) with 15 points and Andrew Strait added 11 for the Grizzlies. Portland State took its first lead of the second half when Huff connected on a 3-pointer with 12:08 remaining. The Vikings went on to score the next eight points to take a 58-48. Montana rallied back behind a barrage of 3-pointers to tie the game at 68 with two minutes left. Elgin-Taylor missed a jumper with 10 seconds left and then fouled Dominguez in the backcourt. After Dominguez put the Vikings ahead, Montana's Cameron Rundles missed a shot at the buzzer while under heavy pressure. Portland State shot 46 percent from the floor and outrebounded Montana 32-24. The Vikings scored the first 10 points of the game of led 17-2 when Dominguez hit two free throws with 13:47 to play in the first half. The Montana came to life behind Martin, rattling off a 28-10 run in the next eight minutes to grab a 30-27 lead. The Grizzlies led 37-34 at the break.
